intro: Pavetta schweinfurthii var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and medicinal properties. The plant typically features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dark blue or black berries as fruit. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
